messages.subject: was gaps between adults and children, now inappropriate laughter
messages.msgSnippet: In a messagedated Sun, 24 Nov 2002 10:35:12 Shyrley  writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a messagedated Sun, 24 Nov 2002 10:35:12
"Shyrley" <shyrley.williams@...> writes:

<<<I must be evil then. I got hit by an inappropriate giggling fit at the
cheesiness and had to hurry out of the theatre to glares from
everyone else.

Shyrley>>>>

When my dh and I were dating we saw Body Double together. I laughed throughout the movie because of the campiness and the obvious take-offs to Hitchcock, whom I adore! I was getting lots of evil glares because most of these *funny* moments were also during the *thriller* moments, like when the drill comes unplugged only millimeters from the victim's stomach. My dh wanted me to leave, but I refused, just glared back at all the old biddies <BWEG> and it's still one of my favorite movies!!

Cindy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
